SEARCH
Package com.app.service.impl.crud

Class OrderServiceImpl

java.lang.Object
com.app.service.impl.crud.GenericServiceImpl<OrderEntity,Order>
com.app.service.impl.crud.OrderServiceImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
CrudService<Order>, OrderService
@Transactional @Service public class OrderServiceImpl extends GenericServiceImpl<OrderEntity,Order> implements OrderService
Implementation of the OrderService interface that provides CRUD operations for managing orders. This service class interacts with repositories for clients, products, and orders, and performs necessary validations before saving orders.

The service methods ensure that clients and products are validated before an order is created.

  • Constructor Details

    • OrderServiceImpl

      public OrderServiceImpl(CrudRepository<OrderEntity> repository, Converter<OrderEntity,Order> converter, ClientRepository clientRepository, OrderRepository orderRepository, ProductRepository productRepository)
      Constructor that initializes the OrderServiceImpl with necessary repositories and a converter.
      Parameters:
      repository - the repository for OrderEntity used by the generic service
      converter - the converter used to convert between OrderEntity and Order
      clientRepository - the repository for ClientEntity used for client lookup
      orderRepository - the repository for OrderEntity used for order persistence
      productRepository - the repository for ProductEntity used for product lookup

  • Method Details

    • addOrder

      public Long addOrder(OrderAddDto orderAddDto)
      Adds a single order based on the provided OrderAddDto.

      This method validates that the client and product exist, then creates and saves an order entity.

      Specified by:
      addOrder in interface OrderService
      Parameters:
      orderAddDto - the DTO containing information about the order to be added
      Returns:
      the ID of the created order
      Throws:
      jakarta.persistence.EntityNotFoundException - if the client or product specified in the DTO is not found

    • addOrders

      public List<Long> addOrders(OrdersAddDto ordersAddDto)
      Adds multiple orders based on the provided OrdersAddDto.

      This method validates that the client exists and that all products specified in the DTO are found in the database. If any product is not found, an EntityNotFoundException is thrown.

      Specified by:
      addOrders in interface OrderService
      Parameters:
      ordersAddDto - the DTO containing information about multiple orders to be added
      Returns:
      a list of IDs of the created orders
      Throws:
      jakarta.persistence.EntityNotFoundException - if the client or any of the products specified in the DTO are not found
